definition: split seam/(fig.) flaw/weak point
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to burst open/to split at the seam
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to feign an opening in order to hoodwink the opponent (in a fight, combat etc)

sentences.english: His remark is full of contradictions and flaws.
sentences.chinese: 他的话前后矛盾，破绽百出。

sentences.english: The nail perforated her coat and left an ugly rip.
sentences.chinese: 钉子穿透她的上衣，留下一块难看的破绽。

sentences.english: For the first time her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentences.chinese: 她温文尔雅的外表第一次露出破绽。

sentences.english: And the hand without any flaw.
sentences.chinese: 而且手上没有任何破绽。

sentences.english: If they attack, concentrate your forces and attack his weakness.
sentences.chinese: 如果敌人进攻，就集中兵力看准敌人的破绽去打击它。

sentences.english: Another similar expression is "showing the fox's tail", meaning let the cat out of bag, or give the game away.
sentences.chinese: 这就跟说“露出了狐狸尾巴”一样，表示露出了破绽。

sentences.english: The robber gave himself away by spending so much money.
sentences.chinese: 那盗贼挥霍金银，露出了破绽。

sentences.english: But, finally will actually expose weaknesses.
The witness tripped up rather badly under close cross-examination.
sentences.chinese: 这个证人在严密的交叉盘问之下破绽百出。

sentences.english: The interviewer tried to trip me up with his questions.
sentences.chinese: 采访人员想用他的问题使我露出破绽。

sentences.english: Liu Han in the headquarters also found the flaw, timely judgment and retreat.
sentences.chinese: 而刘汉在司令部外也发现了破绽，及时判断并撤退。

definition: sth one wishes to conceal/the cat (as in "let the cat out of the bag")
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
lit. spider's thread and horse track/tiny hints (of a secret)/traces/clue
trick/ruse/crafty scheme
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
careless mistake/slip-up
boundary/clue/indication/to obtain clues/to infer
to slip/to overlook by negligence/careless omission/oversight
to penetrate/to see through
gap/interval
vital part/(fig.) key point/crucial
opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
Achilles' heel/chink in the armor
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
hiding place/hideout
crack/gap between two objects/gap in time between two events
